tasks.title: Setup Project Repository and Initial Structure
tasks.description: Initialize the project repository with Swift/SwiftUI, set up Xcode project, and define basic folder structure for MVVM architecture.
tasks.details: Create a new Xcode project targeting macOS 13.0+. Set up folders for Models, Views, ViewModels, Services, and Utilities. Initialize Git repository and add basic README and .gitignore. Configure Swift 5.5+ and SwiftUI 3+ as minimum requirements.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify project builds and runs on macOS 13.0+. Check folder structure and Xcode project settings.

subtasks.title: Initialize Xcode Project with Basic Configuration
subtasks.description: Create a new Xcode project with SwiftUI template targeting macOS 13.0+ and configure the basic project settings.
subtasks.details: Launch Xcode and create a new project using the SwiftUI App template. Set the deployment target to macOS 13.0+. Configure Swift 5.5+ as the language version. Set up the app's bundle identifier, team, and initial capabilities. Ensure SwiftUI 3+ is selected as the framework.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify project builds successfully with no errors and runs in the simulator with a default SwiftUI view.

subtasks.title: Implement MVVM Folder Structure
subtasks.description: Organize the project with a proper MVVM architecture folder structure to separate concerns and improve maintainability.
subtasks.details: Create main group folders for Models, Views, ViewModels, Services, and Utilities. Within the Views folder, create subfolders for different UI components or screens. Set up a Resources folder for assets, localization files, and other non-code resources. Move existing template files to their appropriate locations in the new structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review folder structure to ensure it follows MVVM principles and all files are properly categorized.

subtasks.title: Initialize Git Repository with Configuration Files
subtasks.description: Set up version control for the project with proper Git configuration and documentation.
subtasks.details: Initialize a Git repository in the project root. Create a comprehensive README.md file describing the project structure, architecture, and setup instructions. Add a .gitignore file tailored for Swift/Xcode projects to exclude build artifacts, user-specific files, and dependencies. Create an initial commit with the basic project structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that .gitignore properly excludes build files and user-specific settings by checking git status output.

subtasks.title: Configure Build Settings and Environment
subtasks.description: Set up proper build configurations for development and production environments.
subtasks.details: Create Debug and Release configuration files. Configure build settings for different environments including compiler optimizations, debug information, and conditional compilation flags. Set up scheme configurations for development, testing, and production. Configure code signing settings for development and distribution.
subtasks.testStrategy: Build the project with different configurations to ensure each environment works correctly with its specific settings.

subtasks.title: Implement Basic App Architecture Components
subtasks.description: Create template files for core MVVM components to establish the architectural foundation.
subtasks.details: Create a base Model protocol and example model implementation. Implement a basic ViewModel protocol with common functionality. Set up a sample View that connects to a ViewModel. Create a Services folder with a basic service protocol and implementation example. Add a DependencyInjection container or service locator to manage dependencies between components.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests for the base components to verify they work together correctly according to MVVM principles.

tasks.title: Define Core Data Models
tasks.description: Design and implement CoreData models for Case, Client, Calendar/Event, Document, and Time Entry entities as specified in the PRD.
tasks.details: Create CoreData entities with attributes and relationships: Case (name, number, type, status, dates, related clients, documents), Client (contact info, cases, communications, billing), Calendar/Event (type, reminders, recurrence, case/client links), Document (metadata, versions, templates, file refs), Time Entry (duration, timestamps, billable, case/task links). Use protocol-oriented design for model interfaces.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for model creation, attribute validation, and relationship integrity. Test CRUD operations on each model.

subtasks.title: Create Core Data Stack
subtasks.description: Implement a robust Core Data stack with proper concurrency support to handle background operations for all entity models
subtasks.details: Set up a Core Data stack that includes NSPersistentContainer, NSManagedObjectContext configurations for main and background contexts, and proper error handling. Ensure all heavy data operations run on background contexts to keep the UI responsive. Implement a singleton pattern for accessing the stack throughout the app.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the stack initialization, context creation, and verify background operations don't block the main thread using XCTest performance tests

subtasks.title: Define Entity Models and Attributes
subtasks.description: Create the Core Data entities (Case, Client, Calendar/Event, Document, Time Entry) with all required attributes in the data model file
subtasks.details: Using the Core Data Model editor, define each entity with appropriate attributes: Case (name, number, type, status, dates), Client (contact info, billing details), Calendar/Event (type, reminders, recurrence), Document (metadata, versions, template flags, file references), and Time Entry (duration, timestamps, billable flag). Set proper data types and validation rules for each attribute.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests that verify entity creation with various attribute combinations and validate constraints are properly enforced

subtasks.title: Implement Entity Relationships
subtasks.description: Define bidirectional relationships between all entities to ensure proper object graph management
subtasks.details: Establish relationships: Case-to-Client (many-to-many), Case-to-Document (one-to-many), Case-to-TimeEntry (one-to-many), Case-to-Event (one-to-many), Client-to-Event (one-to-many), etc. Configure appropriate delete rules (cascade, nullify) for each relationship. Ensure all relationships are bidirectional to allow Core Data to properly manage the object graph. Consider denormalizing certain attributes for performance optimization where appropriate.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test relationship creation, navigation between entities, and verify delete rules work as expected with cascading deletions

subtasks.title: Create Protocol-Oriented Model Interfaces
subtasks.description: Design and implement protocols that define the interface for interacting with each entity model
subtasks.details: Create protocols for each entity type (CaseProtocol, ClientProtocol, etc.) that define the required properties and methods. Implement extensions on the NSManagedObject subclasses to conform to these protocols. This approach decouples the Core Data implementation from the rest of the app and facilitates testing. Include computed properties for derived values and helper methods for common operations.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create mock implementations of the protocols for testing business logic without Core Data dependencies

subtasks.title: Implement CRUD Operations and Fetching
subtasks.description: Create service classes to handle Create, Read, Update, Delete operations and fetching for all entity models
subtasks.details: Develop service classes for each entity type that handle persistence operations. Implement methods for creating, updating, and deleting entities with proper error handling. Create specialized fetch requests with predicates and sort descriptors for common query patterns. Ensure all operations follow concurrency best practices by performing work on background contexts and synchronizing with the main context when needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create integration tests that verify the full lifecycle of entities from creation to deletion, including fetching with various predicates and sorting options

tasks.title: Implement Core Application Layer and Navigation
tasks.description: Build the core application layer with MVVM architecture and set up basic navigation using SwiftUI.
tasks.details: Implement App and Scene delegates. Set up root NavigationView or NavigationSplitView. Create basic ViewModels for navigation state. Use SwiftUI for UI components. Implement modular component structure for maintainability.
tasks.testStrategy: Test navigation flows between main views. Verify MVVM separation and modularity.

subtasks.title: Create MVVM Model Structure
subtasks.description: Define the core data models that will be used throughout the application, following the Model component of MVVM architecture.
subtasks.details: Create a Models directory and implement base model protocols and concrete model classes. Define identifiable models with appropriate properties and methods. Ensure models are immutable where appropriate and include necessary business logic within the model layer.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for model validation logic and data transformation methods.

subtasks.title: Implement Container ViewModel for Navigation
subtasks.description: Create a container ViewModel class that will manage navigation state across the application.
subtasks.details: Create a ContainerViewModel class conforming to ObservableObject protocol. Implement a published NavigationPath property to track navigation state. Add lifecycle methods (init/deinit) for proper resource management. Include methods to push, pop and reset navigation as needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test navigation state changes and verify proper cleanup during deinit.

subtasks.title: Set Up App and Scene Delegates
subtasks.description: Configure the application entry point and scene management to establish the foundation for the SwiftUI application.
subtasks.details: Create App struct conforming to App protocol. Configure WindowGroup with the root view. If needed, implement UIApplicationDelegate and UISceneDelegate for additional lifecycle control. Set up environment objects for dependency injection at the app level.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify app initialization and proper scene configuration with UI tests.

subtasks.title: Build Root Navigation Structure
subtasks.description: Implement the root navigation container view that will serve as the foundation for the application's navigation system.
subtasks.details: Create a ContainerView that uses NavigationStack or NavigationSplitView. Inject the ContainerViewModel as a StateObject. Configure the navigation destination builder to handle different view destinations. Implement proper view modifiers for navigation appearance and behavior.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test navigation flows between different screens and verify proper state preservation.

subtasks.title: Create Modular UI Components
subtasks.description: Develop reusable SwiftUI components that will be used throughout the application to ensure consistency and maintainability.
subtasks.details: Create a Components directory with subdirectories for different component types. Implement reusable views like buttons, cards, and list items. Create view modifiers for consistent styling. Ensure components follow MVVM by connecting to ViewModels where appropriate. Document usage patterns for each component.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create snapshot tests for UI components and interaction tests for interactive elements.

tasks.title: Case Management: Creation and Editing
tasks.description: Implement UI and logic for creating and editing case files with comprehensive metadata.
tasks.details: Build SwiftUI forms for case creation/editing. Include fields for name, number, type, status, dates, assigned team, and document references. Connect to CoreData models. Support basic validation.
tasks.testStrategy: Test form validation, case creation, editing, and persistence. Verify metadata integrity.

subtasks.title: Design SwiftUI Form Layout for Case Metadata
subtasks.description: Create the SwiftUI form structure for case creation and editing, including all required fields: name, number, type, status, dates, assigned team, and document references.
subtasks.details: Use SwiftUI's Form, Section, TextField, Picker, and DatePicker components to lay out the form. Organize fields into logical sections for clarity and usability. Ensure the UI is visually clear and user-friendly, applying grouping and styling as needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all fields are present, properly labeled, and visually grouped. Check that the form renders correctly on various device sizes.

subtasks.title: Implement State Management and Data Binding
subtasks.description: Set up @State and @Binding variables to manage form input and enable editing of existing case data.
subtasks.details: Declare @State variables for each form field. For editing, initialize these variables with existing case data. Ensure two-way binding between UI controls and state variables for real-time updates.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test that changes in the UI update the state variables and that editing an existing case pre-populates the form with correct data.

subtasks.title: Integrate CoreData Model Connectivity
subtasks.description: Connect the form to CoreData models to support creating new cases and updating existing ones.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to save new case entries and update existing records in CoreData. Use @Environment(\.managedObjectContext) and fetch requests as needed. Ensure relationships (e.g., assigned team, document references) are properly handled.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create and edit cases, then verify persistence and correctness in the CoreData store.

subtasks.title: Add Input Validation and Error Handling
subtasks.description: Implement validation logic for required fields and provide user feedback for invalid or incomplete input.
subtasks.details: Use conditional logic and @State variables to check for missing or invalid data (e.g., empty name, invalid dates). Display inline error messages or disable the save button until validation passes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Attempt to submit incomplete or invalid forms and verify that errors are shown and submission is blocked.

subtasks.title: Implement Document Reference Selection and Linking
subtasks.description: Enable users to select and link document references within the case form, supporting both creation and editing scenarios.
subtasks.details: Provide a UI component (e.g., Picker or List) for selecting documents from available options. Ensure selected documents are linked to the case in CoreData and reflected in the UI.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test adding, editing, and removing document references, and verify correct linkage in the data model.

tasks.title: Basic Client Information Management
tasks.description: Implement UI and logic for managing client profiles and contact information.
tasks.details: Create SwiftUI forms for client profiles (name, contact info, case relationships). Connect to CoreData. Support basic CRUD operations.
tasks.testStrategy: Test client profile creation, editing, and deletion. Verify relationship with cases.

subtasks.title: Create Client Profile Form UI
subtasks.description: Implement the SwiftUI form interface for client profile information including text fields for name, contact details, and case relationships
subtasks.details: Create a new SwiftUI View with Form and Section components. Implement TextField components for first name, last name, email, and phone number. Add a Toggle for active/inactive status. Use @State variables to manage form data. Ensure proper layout and styling consistent with app design.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify form renders correctly on different device sizes. Test input validation for required fields and proper format for email/phone.

subtasks.title: Design CoreData Model for Client Profiles
subtasks.description: Create the CoreData model entities and relationships needed to store client profile information
subtasks.details: Define a Client entity with attributes for firstName, lastName, email, phone, and status. Create relationships to Case entities. Set up appropriate data types, validation rules, and default values. Generate NSManagedObject subclasses for type-safe access.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test model creation with sample data. Verify relationships work correctly. Ensure proper data validation rules are enforced.

subtasks.title: Implement Client Profile CRUD Operations
subtasks.description: Create service layer to handle Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations for client profiles using CoreData
subtasks.details: Develop a ClientProfileService class with methods for saving new clients, fetching clients (individual and lists), updating client information, and deleting clients. Implement proper error handling and CoreData context management. Use async/await for asynchronous operations.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for each CRUD operation. Test edge cases like duplicate entries, invalid data, and concurrent modifications.

subtasks.title: Connect Form UI to CoreData
subtasks.description: Integrate the SwiftUI form with CoreData operations to enable saving and loading client information
subtasks.details: Create a view model to bridge between UI and data layer. Implement methods to populate form fields from CoreData entities and save form data back to CoreData. Add validation logic before saving. Use @ObservedObject or @StateObject for the view model in the form view.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test data flow from UI to CoreData and back. Verify changes persist after app restart. Test validation error handling and user feedback.

subtasks.title: Implement Client List View with Navigation
subtasks.description: Create a list view of all clients with navigation to individual client profile forms for viewing and editing
subtasks.details: Build a SwiftUI List view that displays client names and basic info. Implement search and filtering capabilities. Create navigation links to the client profile form. Add swipe actions for quick delete and status toggle. Use FetchRequest or a view model to retrieve client data.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test navigation flow between list and detail views. Verify list updates when clients are added, modified, or deleted. Test search and filter functionality with various criteria.

tasks.title: Simple Calendar View and Event Management
tasks.description: Implement a basic calendar view for visualizing and managing case-related events.
tasks.details: Use SwiftUI to build a calendar component. Display events (court dates, deadlines, meetings). Support event creation, editing, and deletion. Connect to CoreData Event model.
tasks.testStrategy: Test event creation, editing, deletion, and calendar display. Verify event-case relationships.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement SwiftUI Calendar View
subtasks.description: Create a reusable SwiftUI calendar component that displays a monthly view and allows date selection.
subtasks.details: Use SwiftUI to build a calendar grid, showing days of the current month. Ensure the component is modular for reuse. Reference best practices for calendar UI in SwiftUI, such as using custom views or integrating with FSCalendar via UIViewRepresentable if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the calendar displays correct dates for various months and allows user to select a date.

subtasks.title: Integrate CoreData Event Model with Calendar
subtasks.description: Connect the calendar view to the CoreData Event model to fetch and display events for each date.
subtasks.details: Fetch events from CoreData and map them to their respective dates. Display event indicators (such as dots or highlights) on days with events. Ensure efficient data fetching and updates when the calendar month changes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with sample events in CoreData to ensure correct mapping and display of event indicators on the calendar.

subtasks.title: Implement Event List and Detail Display
subtasks.description: Show a list of events for the selected date and provide a detail view for each event.
subtasks.details: When a user selects a date, display a list of events for that day below or beside the calendar. Allow tapping on an event to view its details in a modal or navigation view.
subtasks.testStrategy: Select different dates and verify that the correct events are listed and detailed information is shown upon selection.

subtasks.title: Enable Event Creation, Editing, and Deletion
subtasks.description: Allow users to create new events, edit existing ones, and delete events directly from the calendar interface.
subtasks.details: Provide UI controls (such as buttons or context menus) for adding, editing, and deleting events. Use forms for event input and ensure changes are persisted to CoreData and reflected in the calendar view.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create, edit, and delete events; confirm changes are saved in CoreData and immediately reflected in the UI.

subtasks.title: Polish UI and Ensure Accessibility
subtasks.description: Refine the calendar and event management UI for usability and accessibility, ensuring a smooth user experience.
subtasks.details: Improve visual design, add accessibility labels, and ensure the interface is navigable via VoiceOver. Test responsiveness and usability on different device sizes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct UI/UX review and accessibility audit; test with VoiceOver and on multiple devices to ensure compliance.

tasks.title: Basic Document Storage Functionality
tasks.description: Implement basic document storage and management within the app.
tasks.details: Allow users to upload, view, and delete documents associated with cases. Store document metadata in CoreData. Use macOS file system for actual file storage. Support basic file operations.
tasks.testStrategy: Test document upload, retrieval, and deletion. Verify metadata and file system integration.

subtasks.title: Implement Document Upload Functionality
subtasks.description: Create the UI and backend logic to allow users to upload documents from their device to the app and associate them with specific cases.
subtasks.details: Develop a file picker interface that allows users to select documents from their local system. Implement file validation to ensure only supported document types are uploaded. Create a service to copy the selected file to the app's designated storage directory in the macOS file system. Generate a unique identifier for each document and store metadata (filename, size, upload date, associated case ID) in CoreData.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with various file types and sizes to ensure proper handling. Verify that files are correctly stored in the file system and metadata is accurately recorded in CoreData.

subtasks.title: Create Document Viewing Interface
subtasks.description: Develop a document viewer component that allows users to preview and read documents within the app without downloading them.
subtasks.details: Implement a document preview component that supports common file formats (PDF, DOC, images). Create a service to retrieve files from the storage location based on metadata stored in CoreData. Design a clean interface for document viewing with appropriate controls (zoom, page navigation for multi-page documents). Include a loading state for when documents are being fetched.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the viewer with different document types to ensure proper rendering. Verify performance with large documents and check that navigation controls work correctly.

subtasks.title: Implement Document Deletion and Management
subtasks.description: Create functionality to allow users to delete documents and manage basic document properties.
subtasks.details: Implement a confirmation dialog before document deletion. Create a service to remove files from the file system and delete corresponding metadata from CoreData. Ensure proper error handling for cases where the file might be missing or locked. Add functionality to update document metadata such as name or description. Implement proper cleanup to avoid orphaned files in the file system.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test deletion with various document states. Verify that both the file and metadata are properly removed. Test error scenarios such as attempting to delete a file that's currently open.

subtasks.title: Develop Document Listing and Search
subtasks.description: Create a document list view that displays all documents associated with a case and implement basic search functionality.
subtasks.details: Design and implement a list view showing document thumbnails/icons, names, and key metadata. Create CoreData queries to fetch documents filtered by case ID. Implement sorting options (by name, date, size, etc.). Add a search field that filters documents based on filename and metadata. Include appropriate empty states and loading indicators.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with various numbers of documents to ensure performance. Verify that search and filtering work correctly. Test edge cases like very long filenames or special characters.

subtasks.title: Implement Document Version Control
subtasks.description: Add basic version control functionality to track changes when documents are updated.
subtasks.details: Modify the document storage system to maintain previous versions when a document is updated rather than overwriting. Update the CoreData schema to track version history with timestamps and version numbers. Create a UI component to view version history and restore previous versions. Implement a service to retrieve specific versions of a document. Consider storage optimization by limiting the number of versions kept.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the version control by creating multiple versions of documents and verifying that history is properly maintained. Test the restoration of previous versions and ensure metadata is correctly updated.

tasks.title: Notification System for Deadlines
tasks.description: Implement a basic notification system for upcoming deadlines and events.
tasks.details: Use macOS Notifications API to alert users of upcoming deadlines. Trigger notifications based on event dates stored in CoreData. Support basic reminder settings.
tasks.testStrategy: Test notification delivery for upcoming events. Verify reminder settings and timing.

subtasks.title: Design CoreData Model for Deadlines and Reminders
subtasks.description: Define and implement the CoreData entities and attributes required to store deadlines, events, and user reminder settings.
subtasks.details: Create CoreData entities such as 'Event' with attributes for title, date, and reminder settings. Ensure the model supports querying for upcoming deadlines and customizable reminder intervals.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify CoreData schema creation and test CRUD operations for events and reminders.

subtasks.title: Implement Deadline Query Logic
subtasks.description: Develop logic to fetch upcoming deadlines and events from CoreData, considering user-defined reminder settings.
subtasks.details: Write functions to query CoreData for events with dates approaching within the configured reminder window. Ensure the logic accounts for different reminder intervals (e.g., 1 day before, 1 hour before).
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test queries with various event and reminder configurations to ensure correct results.

subtasks.title: Integrate macOS Notifications API
subtasks.description: Set up and configure the macOS User Notifications framework to enable local notifications for upcoming deadlines.
subtasks.details: Request notification permissions from the user and configure UNUserNotificationCenter. Implement code to schedule local notifications based on the queried deadlines and reminder settings.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test notification permission flow and verify that notifications can be scheduled and displayed.

subtasks.title: Schedule and Trigger Notifications Based on Event Dates
subtasks.description: Implement logic to schedule notifications at the appropriate times based on event dates and reminder settings.
subtasks.details: For each upcoming event, calculate the notification trigger time and use the Notifications API to schedule the alert. Ensure notifications are updated or canceled if events are modified or deleted.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create events with various dates and reminders, then verify notifications are triggered at the correct times.

subtasks.title: Implement Basic Reminder Settings UI
subtasks.description: Create a simple user interface to allow users to set and modify reminder preferences for each deadline or event.
subtasks.details: Add UI components for users to select reminder intervals (e.g., 1 hour, 1 day before event). Ensure changes are saved to CoreData and reflected in notification scheduling.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test UI interactions and confirm that changing reminder settings updates notification behavior accordingly.

tasks.title: Document Template System
tasks.description: Implement a basic document template system for legal document generation.
tasks.details: Design template data model in CoreData. Build UI for selecting and populating templates with case/client data. Use PDFKit for document generation. Support basic field mapping.
tasks.testStrategy: Test template selection, population, and PDF generation. Verify field mapping and document output.

subtasks.title: Design CoreData Template Model
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive data model in CoreData to store document templates with appropriate relationships and attributes
subtasks.details: Define entities for Template, TemplateField, and TemplateSection. Include attributes for template name, description, category, and version control. Establish relationships between templates and their components. Implement validation rules for required fields and data types.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests to verify model integrity, relationship persistence, and data validation rules

subtasks.title: Develop Template Selection Interface
subtasks.description: Build a user interface for browsing, searching, and selecting document templates
subtasks.details: Create a hierarchical navigation view with categories and template listings. Implement search functionality with filtering options. Design template preview capabilities. Include template metadata display (creation date, version, description). Add favorites or recently used templates section.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct UI testing to verify navigation paths, search functionality, and template selection process

subtasks.title: Implement Data Input Mechanism
subtasks.description: Create forms and input fields for users to populate templates with case/client data
subtasks.details: Design dynamic form generation based on template field requirements. Implement various input types (text fields, date pickers, dropdowns, etc.). Add validation for required fields and data formats. Create a progress indicator for form completion. Include ability to save partial data and resume later.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test form generation with different template types and validate data capture accuracy

subtasks.title: Build Data Mapping System
subtasks.description: Develop the system to map user-inputted data to template placeholders
subtasks.details: Create a mapping engine to connect form inputs to template fields. Implement placeholder syntax for templates. Support conditional content based on input values. Add support for repeating sections (e.g., for multiple parties). Develop error handling for missing or invalid mappings.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test mapping accuracy with various data types and complex template structures

subtasks.title: Integrate PDFKit for Document Generation
subtasks.description: Use PDFKit to generate final PDF documents with mapped data
subtasks.details: Implement PDF generation pipeline using PDFKit. Create template-to-PDF rendering logic. Add support for styling and formatting options. Implement document preview functionality. Include options for saving, sharing, and printing generated documents. Add metadata to generated PDFs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify PDF output quality, formatting accuracy, and proper data insertion across different document types

tasks.title: Enhanced Navigation and Dashboard
tasks.description: Refine navigation and add a dashboard with key metrics and upcoming events.
tasks.details: Improve sidebar and split-view navigation. Add dashboard view with case stats, upcoming deadlines, and recent activity. Use SwiftUI for dynamic layout.
tasks.testStrategy: Test dashboard data accuracy and navigation flow. Verify UI responsiveness.

subtasks.title: Refactor and Enhance Sidebar Navigation
subtasks.description: Redesign the sidebar navigation using SwiftUI to improve usability and visual clarity, ensuring it adapts responsively to different device sizes (iPhone, iPad, Mac).
subtasks.details: Implement the sidebar as a SwiftUI List embedded in a NavigationView. Follow Apple Human Interface Guidelines for sidebars, ensuring clear sectioning and iconography. Add selection logic and state management for navigation. Test on multiple device simulators for adaptive layout.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify sidebar displays correctly on all supported devices, navigation updates views as expected, and selection state is preserved.

subtasks.title: Implement Split-View Navigation Structure
subtasks.description: Introduce a split-view navigation pattern to allow users to view and interact with multiple content panes simultaneously.
subtasks.details: Use SwiftUI's NavigationView with multiple columns to create a split-view layout. Ensure seamless transitions between sidebar, detail, and content views. Bind selection state to update the detail pane dynamically.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test navigation flow between sidebar and detail views, ensuring correct content is displayed and navigation state is maintained.

subtasks.title: Design Dashboard Layout with Key Metrics
subtasks.description: Create a dashboard view in SwiftUI that displays case statistics, upcoming deadlines, and recent activity in a visually organized manner.
subtasks.details: Design the dashboard using SwiftUI stacks and grids for dynamic layout. Use cards or sections for each metric (case stats, deadlines, activity). Ensure the layout is responsive and visually distinct.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that all dashboard sections render correctly, metrics update with sample data, and layout adapts to screen size.

subtasks.title: Integrate Data Sources for Dashboard Metrics
subtasks.description: Connect the dashboard view to real or mock data sources to populate case statistics, deadlines, and recent activity.
subtasks.details: Implement data models and fetch logic for each dashboard metric. Use SwiftUI's data binding to update the dashboard in real time. Provide sample/mock data for development and testing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate that dashboard metrics reflect the underlying data, update in real time, and handle empty or error states gracefully.

subtasks.title: Polish UI and Add Interactivity to Dashboard and Navigation
subtasks.description: Enhance the user experience by refining UI elements, adding animations, and enabling interactions such as tapping metrics for details or navigating to related views.
subtasks.details: Apply SwiftUI modifiers for visual polish (shadows, rounded corners, color schemes). Add tap gestures to dashboard cards to navigate to detailed views. Ensure accessibility and smooth animations for transitions.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test all interactive elements for responsiveness, verify navigation from dashboard metrics, and review UI for consistency and accessibility.

tasks.title: Client Communication Logging
tasks.description: Implement logging for client communications and meeting notes.
tasks.details: Add communication log model in CoreData. Build UI for logging calls, emails, and meetings. Associate logs with clients and cases.
tasks.testStrategy: Test log creation, retrieval, and association. Verify data integrity.

subtasks.title: Create Communication Log Core Data Model
subtasks.description: Design and implement the Core Data model for client communication logging
subtasks.details: Create a new Core Data entity named 'CommunicationLog' with attributes for date, type (call/email/meeting), duration, summary, and action items. Add relationships to existing Client and Case entities. Include necessary validation rules and default values.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify model creation by instantiating test objects and confirming persistence across app restarts

subtasks.title: Implement CRUD Operations Manager
subtasks.description: Develop a manager class to handle all database operations for communication logs
subtasks.details: Create a CommunicationLogManager class with methods for creating, reading, updating, and deleting communication logs. Implement filtering capabilities to retrieve logs by client, case, date range, and communication type. Add error handling and validation logic.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test each CRUD operation with sample data to ensure proper persistence and retrieval

subtasks.title: Design Communication Log UI Components
subtasks.description: Create reusable UI components for displaying and entering communication logs
subtasks.details: Design a form view for entering new logs with fields for all required attributes. Create a detail view for displaying existing logs. Implement a list view component for showing communication history. Ensure all components support different communication types (call, email, meeting).
subtasks.testStrategy: Perform UI testing to verify form validation, data display, and navigation between components

subtasks.title: Integrate Communication Log with Client and Case Views
subtasks.description: Add communication logging functionality to existing client and case screens
subtasks.details: Update the client detail view to show associated communication logs. Modify the case detail view to display case-specific communications. Add action buttons to create new logs from both screens. Implement filtering options to sort and search through logs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test integration points to ensure logs are correctly associated with clients and cases

subtasks.title: Implement Communication Log Reports and Export
subtasks.description: Create reporting functionality for communication logs
subtasks.details: Develop a reporting screen to view communication statistics and summaries. Add filtering by date range, client, case, and communication type. Implement export functionality to generate PDF or CSV reports of communication history. Include charts to visualize communication patterns.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify report generation with various filter combinations and validate exported file formats

tasks.title: Search Functionality Across Data Types
tasks.description: Implement search across cases, clients, documents, and events.
tasks.details: Build search bar and results view. Query CoreData for matches in all relevant models. Support basic filtering and sorting.

tasks.title: Refactor ensure_xcode_files.sh for Shared Workspace Compliance
tasks.description: The ensure_xcode_files.sh script needs to be updated. It currently creates a non-standard nested `project.xcworkspace` within `.xcodeproj` bundles. It should instead: 1. NOT create these nested workspaces. 2. Focus on verifying and, if necessary, correctly configuring the single shared `_{PlatformDir}/{ProjectName}.xcworkspace` to ensure it includes valid `<FileRef>` entries for both production (`{ProjectName}/{ProjectName}.xcodeproj`) and sandbox (`{ProjectName}-Sandbox/{ProjectName}-Sandbox.xcodeproj`) projects. 3. Ensure logs are correctly written to the `logs/` directory as per .cursorrules. This is a P0 compliance fix.
tasks.details: Update script logic to align with .cursorrules 5.1.1. Remove nested workspace creation. Add verification for shared workspace project references. Ensure robust logging to `logs/` and not project root.

subtasks.title: Remove nested workspace creation logic
subtasks.description: Modify ensure_xcode_files.sh to eliminate code that creates nested project.xcworkspace within .xcodeproj bundles
subtasks.details: Identify and remove all script sections that create or modify nested workspaces. This includes finding patterns like 'mkdir -p *.xcodeproj/project.xcworkspace' or similar commands. Ensure removal is complete while preserving other essential functionality. Update any related documentation comments to reflect this change.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run the modified script against a test project and verify no nested workspaces are created. Use 'find . -name "project.xcworkspace" -path "*.xcodeproj/*"' to confirm absence of nested workspaces.

subtasks.title: Implement shared workspace verification
subtasks.description: Add functionality to verify the existence and structure of the shared _{PlatformDir}/{ProjectName}.xcworkspace
subtasks.details: Create a function that checks if the shared workspace exists at the expected path. If it doesn't exist, create it with the proper structure. Use Xcode workspace format specifications to ensure compliance. The function should determine the correct platform directory and project name dynamically from the environment or parameters.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with both existing and non-existing workspaces to verify proper detection and creation. Validate workspace structure using 'plutil -lint' on the workspace's contents.xcworkspacedata file.

subtasks.title: Configure FileRef entries for production and sandbox projects
subtasks.description: Ensure the shared workspace includes valid FileRef entries for both the main project and its sandbox counterpart
subtasks.details: Parse the contents.xcworkspacedata XML file to check for and add required FileRef entries. Implement logic to correctly reference both {ProjectName}/{ProjectName}.xcodeproj and {ProjectName}-Sandbox/{ProjectName}-Sandbox.xcodeproj. Use relative paths to ensure portability across different development environments. Handle edge cases where projects might have non-standard naming.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify FileRef entries by opening the workspace in Xcode and confirming both projects appear. Also validate XML structure programmatically by parsing the contents.xcworkspacedata file.

subtasks.title: Implement robust logging system
subtasks.description: Update the script to ensure all logs are written to the logs/ directory as per .cursorrules
subtasks.details: Create a logging function that directs all output to appropriate files in the logs/ directory. Ensure the logs/ directory exists or is created if missing. Implement different log levels (INFO, WARNING, ERROR) and timestamp each entry. Update all existing log statements in the script to use this new logging system. Remove any direct output to project root.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run the script with various inputs and verify logs appear in the correct location with proper formatting. Check for absence of log files in the project root.

subtasks.title: Add dependency configuration for parallel builds
subtasks.description: Configure the workspace to support dependency-based parallel builds for improved performance
subtasks.details: Modify the script to set the workspace build configuration to use 'Dependency Order' instead of 'Manual Order'. Enable the 'Find Implicit Dependencies' option to allow Xcode to automatically determine build dependencies between targets. This will improve build performance on multi-core systems and ensure correct build order based on the project's dependency graph.

tasks.title: Track and Document Directory Structure Reorganization for P0 Violation Fix
tasks.description: Document and track the directory structure reorganization implemented to resolve critical P0 violations, including moving Xcode workspace/project files, consolidating build directories, and updating scripts.
tasks.details:
Review and document all changes made to the project directory structure as part of the P0 violation fix. This includes:
- Verifying that Xcode workspace (.xcworkspace) and project (.xcodeproj) files have been moved to their correct platform-specific directories, following best practices for Xcode project organization[1][2][3][4].
- Ensuring all build artifacts are now consolidated under temp/build, and that the legacy tmp/ folder has been removed in favor of the new temp/ directory.
- Confirming that the fix_project_directory_structure.sh script accurately performs these operations and is included in the repository.
- Updating any project documentation (e.g., README, developer onboarding guides) to reflect the new directory structure and usage of the script.
- Coordinating with the team to ensure all references to old paths are updated in build scripts, CI/CD configurations, and documentation.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run fix_project_directory_structure.sh and verify that all Xcode workspace and project files are correctly located in their platform-specific directories.
2. Confirm that all build outputs are present in temp/build and that tmp/ no longer exists.
3. Review the repository to ensure no references to the old tmp/ directory remain in scripts, documentation, or configuration files.
4. Build and run the project from the reorganized structure to ensure no regressions or build errors occur.
5. Check that documentation accurately describes the new directory layout and script usage.

tasks.title: Implement MVP-Ready, Professional UX/UI Enhancements for Core Enterprise Screens
tasks.description: Design and implement polished, business-grade UX/UI improvements for the Landing Page, Dashboard, Settings, Account/Profile, About Us, and Help & Support screens, strictly following the Corporate Style Guide and prioritizing for MVP.

subtasks.title: Implement Screen-Specific UX/UI Enhancements

tasks.title: Implement Production-Ready Apple SSO and Google SSO with Environment Configuration and Testing

tasks.details:

7. Prioritize clear error messaging and user feedback throughout the authentication process to meet MVP standards.
tasks.testStrategy:
- Verify that both Apple SSO and Google SSO can be configured entirely via /.env values, with no hardcoded secrets or credentials.
- Manually test sign-in and sign-out flows for both providers, confirming correct user data retrieval and session management.
- Run automated unit and integration tests covering successful authentication, error handling, and edge cases for both SSO providers.
- Validate that the authentication UI matches the example code and provides clear feedback for all states (loading, success, error).
- Confirm that documentation is accurate and that a new developer can set up both SSO providers using only the provided instructions and environment variables.

tasks.title: Design and Implement Vibrant, Animated SwiftUI Landing Page for MVP

subtasks.title: Develop Animated Hero Section Component

tasks.title: Implement SSO-Driven Profile/Data Synchronization with User Model for MVP
tasks.description: Enable seamless sharing and synchronization of user profile data between Single Sign-On (SSO) providers and the application's Profile/User model, ensuring accurate and secure data mapping for MVP.

subtasks.title: Integrate SSO Authentication Flow for Apple and Google
